column4: Ok. Nothing actually but it needs a log on to a website. Each time you try to download the file, it gives a new ID number. I am connecting to another server using PuTTY. I don't have
VNC access to otherwise access it.
So, is it possible to download files with variable download IDs using putty when SSHing to another server without VNC access?
It's http, not ftp by the way.
Ok in putty, you have a command called wget. I am trying to use that std0s
I am trying to use wget to download a file onto the server.
Ok. Let me give you an example. Filename.avi?id=12456. That number changes each time I try to download via a regular browser _xan_ .
So, it's possible in putty to specify login and then download the file?
but I don't want to get it through my browser
I want to download it on my server.
in general a scheme like that is because the website wants you to use a browser...and won't let you get it without one
why not download the file on our own system and then copy it to the destination?
my upload speed is really slow
it's not trivial...(almost) everything is possible
try it in links2 (a text based web browser)
if it's alerady installed, yes.  Umm, if it's "your" server then why not?
yeah, that's to make sure you only download it from a web broswer that you've signed in on.  I doubt you'll be able to get the file with wget
put the url in "", it will give you the file (in this one particular case)
not on a server install no...a GUI browser would be unusual
